concept_data.title: European Centre of Enterprises with Public Participation and of Enterprises of General Economic Interest
concept_data.preferred_term: European Centre of Enterprises with Public Participation

summary: The "European Centre of Enterprises with Public Participation" serves as a pivotal institution within the EU framework, focusing on enterprises that operate under public participation and those classified as enterprises of general economic interest. This Centre facilitates the collaboration between public entities and private enterprises, ensuring compliance with EU regulations that govern public service obligations and economic activities. As a redirect to the preferred term, it underscores the importance of public participation in fostering economic interests while adhering to legal standards. The Centre plays a crucial role in promoting transparency and accountability in the management of public resources across member states.
